meanings.definition: Having no particular interest or sympathy; unconcerned.
meanings.sent1: She was indifferent to the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent2: The student seemed indifferent to the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent3: The cat was indifferent to the new toy, preferring to nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood indifferent to the changing seasons, rooted in its place.
meanings.sent5: His indifferent attitude made it hard for others to connect with him.

meanings.sent1: The meal was indifferent, neither delicious nor terrible.
meanings.sent2: The movie received indifferent reviews from critics.
meanings.sent3: The indifferent weather made it hard to decide what to wear.
meanings.sent4: The painting was so indifferent that it failed to evoke any emotion.
meanings.sent5: Her indifferent singing didn't impress the judges at all.

meanings.definition: Showing no partiality or bias; impartial.
meanings.sent1: The judge remained indifferent to the defendant's pleas.
meanings.sent2: The referee was indifferent to both teams, making fair calls.
meanings.sent3: The indifferent jury listened to the evidence with blank expressions.
meanings.sent4: The scale of justice remained indifferent, balancing without favor.
meanings.sent5: Her indifferent decision surprised everyone with its fairness.
